page.title: 23River Wharfe at Tadcaster
page.content:
Flood banks were raised about five years ago. There has been no serious flooding here since 2000. The river is as avidly fished in as before but the banks are overgrown, the foliage tailing in water when the river is up. Walks along the river banks and over the viaduct are popular and a duck race organised by the the swimming pool volunteers is well attended.
Contribution by: Peter Bradshaw
